Interface ObservationInterface


  • public interface ObservationInterface
    An ObservationInterface object represents data from one monthly observation within a weather station as found at the MetOffice Historic Station Data. Observations are associated with a weather station in the WeatherStation, so that information about the WeatherStation should not be encoded in the Observation itself. Data records include: year of observation; month of observation (1-12); mean daily maximum temperature; mean daily minimum temperature; days of air frost; total rainfall; total sunshine duration. Observation records may be provisional. You may assume that all observation data are present (i.e. ignore cases with --- in historic data files). You should include a constructor which takes as a parameter the year (as an int) and the month (as an int)

      • getTMean

        double getTMean()
        Returns:
        monthly mean temperature, calculated from the average of the mean daily maximum and mean daily minimum temperature i.e. (tmax+tmin)/2.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the observation formatted as in the MetOffice file i.e. data fields eight characters wide, doubles printed to one decimal place. E.g. 
           1925  12    4.3    -1.2      18    79.4    61.3
        See Also:
        String.format(String, Object...)

      • update

        void update(java.lang.String observationLine)
        Update all fields based on a string provided.
        Parameters:
        observationLine - A String formatted as in one line in the MetOffice file. You may assume that all data items are present and that there are no * or # markers on the data. Observations potinally have a Provisional marker at the end of the line.
